comment: A good professor who is willing to help. Writes out all her notes (not posted but will let you take pictures) around 4-5 chps. for each test. If you study the material well it is possible to make an A or B in her class. Drops the lowest test. Hw helps boost your grade since it is pretty easy and plenty of time to complete. I recommend her.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I had her for Ecology Lab. LOVED HER! She was so flexible and always gave time for lab turn-ins. Her expectations are clear and understandable. My favorite is that she always checks off that you are doing your lab correctly before you begin the work so it is not wrong. We also never stayed the whole time.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment:
In this course currently but I know Spring 23' registration opens soon so I wanted to help deter people from these harsh reviews. She is a great professor! Very friendly and funny. The course is challenging but its an upper-level biology course so that is to be expected. 
Come to class!! No notes posted. You can easily pass if you put in effort.

Professor Sutton is very sweet. They way she goes over material is straightforward and She will answer any questions you have. Her exams are somewhat hard but you have to study the material because she does give you a lot to study and you never know what exactly is going to be on the exam.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Sutton is a really awesome lab professor! She actually cares to get to know her students and interacts with us in class. She is always ready to help out and answer questions if you just ask. Her labs are pretty fun, only thing I would watch out for are the pre-lab quizzes. They are mostly pretty straight forward but can get a little confusing.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Caring

comment: I am rating the TA, Leigh. Class was much harder than I thought. Statistic heavy. Report heavy. Really taught me how to write hypothesis & predictions. TA gave great feedback and was lenient when she could be. She was fun and cool. Loved to use memes.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: dr sutton is a fun lecturer and is nice to students but her exams were very difficult. we had 4 exams/lowest grade dropped. the content felt pretty self-explanatory but her exams were confusing for no reason. i understood all of the concepts but struggled with the exam content
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She is enthusiastic, but had not taught this course in years. She is a tough grader. Not very lenient nor does extra credit. Her first quiz of the semester was extremely difficult, dropped nearly everyone's grade. She's not bad, but does fail to mention some important directions in class. She's sweet but I don't think she is meant for this course.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters

comment: I LOVE HER SO MUCH. She takes notes with you so you see exactly what to write down. The tests are very fair. The people who don't do well probably miss lectures or don't study (she doesn't post the notes). She is hilarious, adorable, and makes the material so interesting. study the notes, textbook, and go to class to get an A.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Inspirational--Hilarious

comment: She is friendly. Achieve homework, 3 exams, and a final but you can drop your lowest including the final! Lectures only so you need to go to class or get notes from someone or read textbook. Posts power points online but they are mostly pics though they sync well with textbook. Never felt tests were excessively difficult.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: Terrible. She's rude, she doesn't care if you pass or not. attendance is mandatory. Her lectures are extremely fast so you're basically teaching yourself. I have yet to find a good Biology professor at this school.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Her exams are HARD even f you study. She goes over 4-5 chapters per exam. If you are worried about your GPA do not take her. If you have a full load of classes and think this one will be easy, well you are wrong. Not with her. AVOID her if you can.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: She gives amazing lectures, but just know that WHATEVER she writes down on her notes, you need to write the EXACT thing. Ive seen many people try to condense her notes and only write down what they though was essential, and that it is what the exam questions are based on. I got an overall A+ and she inspired me to go into ecology for grad school!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: She is sweet & funny, but her tests are impossible. I had an easier time with Ochem. I attended almost every class (not mandatory but if you dont go to class youre sure to fail) & studied my butt off & still failed the tests; they are extremely specific. The lab exams are even harder, no one got an A or B & all fill in the blank. Avoid if u can
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Her strengths include great and quick feedback, well put together PowerPoints, and interesting lectures. A lot of people struggle with taking her tests, but doing your study guide, taking practice tests, and doing the labs will get you a good grade. Her homework is fairly easy.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Gives good feedback

comment: Whereas most professors give partial credit for written response, it feels like she takes credit away if you get the correct answer but are not extremely specific with your responses. Written response is a huge part of exams. Lab exams were really hard too. Overall, the class feels shockingly harder than both Ochems combined!
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: The professor is nice but her exams are extremely hard. She says her exams are from her PowerPoints but they dont add up. Even Ecology majors where having a hard time with the exams. 4 exams @40 questions and a final. She drops the lowest grade if you take the final. The final is comulative 70 questions. I would avoid her if you care about GPA.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Sutton is an amazing professor! Not only does she care about her students, but she also cares that you understand the material. I think some of these reviews are harsh and what people are leaving out is that she teaches upper level courses with dense material. Its not going to be a cakewalk, but if you make an effort you will see good results.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: She is wonderful for lab. You know exactly what you have to write about in the reports and she even helps you with what predictions and statistical tests you need to do. There are 2 40 point reports and all other small reports are 20 points. Ask questions and stick with the rubric and you will get an A. Easy grader and down to earth woman!

Her tests were impossible, it felt like. I studied and felt like I grasped the material but I was very wrong according to my test results. All the grades come from tests, so get ready to study because this class is not a breeze. She is a pretty cool professor in person she jokes with the class, but her class content is no joke- very detail oriented
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: By far one of my most favorite profs. Lecture isnt mandatory, but strongly encouraged. If you attend lecture and participate a little, you wont even have to read the textbook and you'll do just fine on the exams. Great passion for teaching and her energy and vibe in the classroom shows it. Very contagious laugh too and exuberant personality.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Surprisingly, I enjoyed this class. Her enthusiasm 4 plants, I think, is what makes it. Not a very difficult class, but material is VERY dense. Lecture - 3 tests, enrichment project (easy A) + final. GO TO CLASS - her exams r based on the notes she writes in class. Lab - random lab turn ins (easy A), 4 quizzes + 2 lab exams (Good Luck on these :))
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Lecture heavy

comment: I took Dr. Sutton for lecture and her tests were AWFUL; however, she is GREAT for lab. There are no tests, just lab reports, most of which took me a day or two to complete. There is one essay assignment which is also pretty easy. She can be a tough grader but if you follow her rubrics and email her with questions you should make an A!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: This class is impossibly difficult. Attendance isn't mandatory and lectures are pointless. Even when I took notes, read the book and studied my butt off, I still failed the tests, which are impossible. The only grades are the tests too. She is a very nice lady but her tests are terrible. I got a higher grade in OChem.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: I took her for Ecology and can I just say this was the HARDEST class I've EVER taken. She makes a simple topic WAY harder than it should be. Her test were ridiculously difficult. They were multiple choice but only 1-2 people made A's each time. She handwrites her notes and they have nothing to do with the class., powerpoint are just pictures!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I really loved Dr. Sutton and her class... The exams though for her ecology class are very hard, and there is no homework, just your test grades. She will do optional extra credit quizzes, but there was only a few that she gave and you had to buy sapling in order to access them 88$ No homework options were giving in sapling. The book is essential.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: dr. sutton is great! she grades tough but is very fair. she'll work with you on everything and is willing to meet in her office to go over grades or assignments. she doesn't have set office hours but is very flexible. provides 8 graded assignments in lab so you have a bunch of graded opportunities. her lectures are great & I definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: The lab was easy and fun. There is a lot of statistic on the assignment .

I had her for lecture and lab. I really like her as a person and as a teacher.  She takes out the time to learn everyone's name. She gives Great lectures. Try not to miss class! she writes down all her notes and doesn't post them on D2L. She teaches with a lot of pictures and examples. but she can be unclear sometimes when she writes. she is smart!
rating_tags: Respected--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: I took Dr. Sutton for Ecology. I'm a Molecular Bio major and I had the hardest time. Her tests are multiple choice, but they were honestly harder than my Genetics tests. She assigned a huge paper on material we hadn't even learned yet, and then didn't give us the grades until the last day of finals. It doesn't seem like she cares about her students
